workflow.name: Transform long content into bite-sized learning modules with GPT-4 & Google Docs
workflow.description:
## Who's it for
Content creators, trainers, and educators who need to convert lengthy documents into digestible micro-learning experiences.

## How it works
This workflow takes your source content (PDFs, articles, handbooks) and uses GPT-4 to intelligently break it into 2-3 minute learning modules. Each module includes a key concept, explanation, practical example, and knowledge check question.

## How to set up
1. Configure OpenAI credentials with GPT-4 access
2. Connect Slack workspace (optional)
3. Set up Google Docs integration
4. Optionally, Send content via webhook or paste directly

## Requirements
- OpenAI API key with GPT-4 access
- Google Docs account (for document creation)
- Slack workspace (optional, for notifications)

## How to customize the workflow
- Adjust module count and length in AI prompts
- Modify output formats (email, mobile, Slack)
- Change document structure and styling
- Add custom delivery channels

Perfect for converting employee handbooks, training materials, and documentation into engaging micro-learning courses that people actually complete.

messages.content: =Break down this content into micro-learning modules: {{ $json.body.content }}

=You are a micro-learning expert. You're receiving a section of a larger document about: "{{ $json.chunker.topic_hint }}".

Analyze this content section and create 2-4 focused micro-learning modules that:
1. Cover the specific topics in this section (don't create modules about topics not mentioned)
2. Are each 2-3 minutes to consume
3. Use the section's actual content (don't add external information)
4. Include practical examples from the provided text
5. Create questions that test understanding of THIS section's content
6. Do not Hallucinate

This is chunk {{ $json.chunker.chunk_id }} of {{ $json.chunker.total_chunks }} from a larger document.

Do not include any text before or after the JSON array.
Return ONLY a valid JSON array with modules containing: 

title, 
key_concept, 
explanation (150-200 words), 
practical_example, 
quick_quiz_question.

parameters.responseBody: {"error": "Missing content field. Please provide content to analyze.", "example": {"content": "Your learning content here..."}}

parameters.content:
# CONTENT PREPARATION

**Extracts and standardizes** the input content for processing.

Purpose:
- Normalizes incoming data format
- Ensures content field exists
- Prepares data for validation step

Output: Clean content ready for chunking

# SMART CONTENT CHUNKING

Breaks large documents into topic-based chunks for optimal AI processing.

Features:
- Topic-based chunking (not arbitrary)
- Preserves section boundaries
- Handles documents up to 20+ pages
- Creates logical content segments

Strategy: Splits by headers, then paragraphs if needed
Max chunk size: 4000 characters

# AI CONTENT PROCESSING

Converts content chunks into structured micro-learning modules.

AI Model: GPT-4
Purpose: Create 2-4 modules per chunk containing:
- Title
- Key concept
- Explanation (150-200 words)
- Practical example
- Quiz question

Each module = 2-3 minutes learning time

# MODULE FORMATTER

Processes AI responses and creates structured module data.

Functions:
- Parses JSON from AI responses
- Handles multiple output formats
- Creates email, Slack, mobile formats
- Adds metadata and sequencing

Output: Standardized module objects

**Note**: Use the Cluade AI or your preferred AI to re-generate this code for your use case,

# GOOGLE DOCS CONVERTER

Transforms micro-learning modules into Google Docs format.

Features:
- Professional document structure
- Course overview section
- Module formatting with headers
- Knowledge check sections
- Completion summary

Output: Clean text ready for Google Docs

TEAM NOTIFICATIONS
Sends course details to Slack channel.

Features:
- Course summary with module count
- First module preview
- Completion notifications
- Error alerts if needed

Channels: Configure your preferred Slack channels

**Note**: This is optional step and can be disabled. When disabling, disable both Slack notification nodes.

# CREATE GOOGLE DOC

Purpose of these nodes is to create a Google Doc and then update the created doc with the generated Google Doc content.

**Update** the Google Doc credentials and the folder where the document should be created.

user.name: inderjeet Bhambra
user.bio: I am on a journey to learn and spread the automations through n8n workflows.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
